channel.title: NPR Topics: World
channel.description: NPR world news, international art and culture, world business and financial markets, world economy, and global trends in health, science and technology. Subscribe to the World Story of the Day podcast and RSS feed.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: Zelenskyy suggests that Ukraine's relationship with U.S. is at risk over peace deal
item.description: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy says his country must choose between "dignity" and U.S. support as peace deal deadline looms.
item.content:encoded: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy says his country must choose between "dignity" and U.S. support as peace deal deadline looms.
item.dc:creator: Joanna Kakissis

item.title: Putin says U.S. plan for Ukraine could form the basis for a final peace settlement
item.description: The plan includes many of Russian President Vladimir Putin's demands. Ukraine's President Volodymyr Zelenskyy said Friday that his country is at "truly one of the most difficult moments in our history."
item.content:encoded:
The plan includes many of Russian President Vladimir Putin's demands. Ukraine's President Volodymyr Zelenskyy said Friday that his country is at "truly one of the most difficult moments in our history."

(Image credit: Kateryna Klochko)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press

item.title: South Africa hosts G20 as tensions with U.S. flare amid boycott
item.description: The U.S. boycotts South Africa's G20 summit, sparking a diplomatic spat and throwing the global gathering into turmoil.
item.content:encoded:
The U.S. boycotts South Africa's G20 summit, sparking a diplomatic spat and throwing the global gathering into turmoil.

(Image credit: Themba Hadebe)
item.dc:creator: Kate Bartlett

item.title: A new Miss Universe is crowned, weeks after she left a pageant event in protest
item.description: This year's Miss Universe competition, held in Bangkok, was marred by a series of dramatic incidents, from a contestant's livestreamed walkout to a now former judge's allegations of rigging.
item.content:encoded:
This year's Miss Universe competition, held in Bangkok, was marred by a series of dramatic incidents, from a contestant's livestreamed walkout to a now former judge's allegations of rigging.

(Image credit: Lillian Suwanrumpha)
item.dc:creator: Rachel Treisman

item.title: Russian hacking suspect wanted by the FBI arrested on Thai resort island
item.description: Thai Police have arrested a suspected Russian hacker who is wanted by the FBI for alleged cyberattacks on U.S. and European government agencies.
item.content:encoded:
Thai Police have arrested a suspected Russian hacker who is wanted by the FBI for alleged cyberattacks on U.S. and European government agencies.

(Image credit: Thailand's Cyber Crime Investigation Bureau)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press

item.title: Rare earths: Federal backing and tech advances aim to help the U.S. catch up to China
item.description: Rare earths aren't all that rare. The real choke point is in processing and refining them, where China enjoys market dominance.
item.content:encoded:
Rare earths aren't all that rare. The real choke point is in processing and refining them, where China enjoys market dominance.

(Image credit: ‎)
item.dc:creator: Scott Neuman

item.title: Al Qaeda-affiliated militants cripple fuel supplies to Mali's capital
item.description: Militants from an Al Qaeda affiliate in land-locked Mali have been attacking fuel convoys for months. The blockade has strangled fuel supplies to the capital city.
item.content:encoded: Militants from an Al Qaeda affiliate in land-locked Mali have been attacking fuel convoys for months. The blockade has strangled fuel supplies to the capital city.
item.dc:creator: Emmanuel Akinwotu

item.title: Fact-checking Trump's claim his family has done 'little' business with Saudi Arabia
item.description: President Trump this week said his family has done "very little" business with Saudi Arabia, as Crown Prince Mohammed visited the White House. NPR fact checks that claim with Forbes' Dan Alexander.
item.content:encoded: President Trump this week said his family has done "very little" business with Saudi Arabia, as Crown Prince Mohammed visited the White House. NPR fact checks that claim with Forbes' Dan Alexander.
item.dc:creator: Leila Fadel

item.title: U.S. presents plan to end the war in Ukraine
item.description: The White House presented a plan for peace to Ukrainian president Volodymyr Zelensky this week, but the proposal requires major concessions from Ukraine.
item.content:encoded: The White House presented a plan for peace to Ukrainian president Volodymyr Zelensky this week, but the proposal requires major concessions from Ukraine.
item.dc:creator: Franco Ordoñez

item.title: Analyst talks about potential deal to end the war in Ukraine
item.description: NPR's Leila Fadel speaks with Hanna Shelest of the Foreign Policy Council's Ukrainian Prism think tank about reports of a deal negotiated by the U.S. and Russia to end the war in Ukraine.
item.content:encoded: NPR's Leila Fadel speaks with Hanna Shelest of the Foreign Policy Council's Ukrainian Prism think tank about reports of a deal negotiated by the U.S. and Russia to end the war in Ukraine.
item.dc:creator: Leila Fadel
